options.content: Folded panels become inactive and do not query database.

To show accurate values in real-time, please set the time range to 5, 10 or 15 minutes and auto-refresh to 10 seconds. The tiles will not show history older than 15 minutes to avoid overloading your server.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
      [time] = [snapshot_time] --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,metric = [counter_name]
      ,[value] = sum([cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters]
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
   AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
   AND snapshot_time >= dateadd(minute,-15,getutcdate())
   AND counter_name IN ('Batch Requests/sec','Readahead pages/sec','Transactions/sec','Processes blocked')
   AND instance_name NOT IN ('mssqlsystemresource')
   AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
   GROUP BY snapshot_time, counter_name --, $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT 
      [time] = [snapshot_time] --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,'Wait Time' = sum(wait_time_ms_delta / [delta_seconds])
      --,'Waiting Tasks' = convert(bigint,sum(waiting_tasks_count_delta / [delta_seconds]) / 1000) --this is similar to waiting tasks in SSMS
  FROM [dbo].[sqlwatch_logger_perf_os_wait_stats]
  WHERE 1=1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
     AND snapshot_time >= dateadd(minute,-15,getutcdate())
  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
  GROUP BY [snapshot_time] --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT 
      [time] = snapshot_time --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,[Bytes Transferred] = AVG([bytes_written_per_second]+[bytes_read_per_second])
      ,[Latency] = MAX([io_latency_read]+[io_latency_write])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_file_stats]
  WHERE 1 = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
     AND snapshot_time >= dateadd(minute,-15,getutcdate())
  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
  GROUP BY snapshot_time --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation)
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT [time] = h.snapshot_time
      , [Long Processes] = count(distinct session_id)
  FROM [dbo].[sqlwatch_logger_snapshot_header] h --this is so we always get row to show the tile, even if there are no rows in the data view. otherwise the tile will not be shown
  left join [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_xes_long_queries] l
    on h.sql_instance = l.sql_instance
    and h.snapshot_time = l.snapshot_time
    and h.snapshot_type_id = l.snapshot_type_id
  WHERE h.[sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
   AND h.snapshot_time >= dateadd(minute,-15,getutcdate())
   AND $__timeFilter(h.snapshot_time)
  group by h.snapshot_time
ORDER BY
  time desc

SELECT top 1 [time]= snapshot_time --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
,[SQL Instance]=count(h.sql_instance)
  FROM dbo.sqlwatch_logger_snapshot_header h
  where snapshot_type_id = 1
    AND h.[sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
   AND $__timeFilter(h.snapshot_time)
      AND snapshot_time >= dateadd(minute,-15,getutcdate())
  group by snapshot_time --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation)

SELECT [time] = getdate(),
 [Checks] = max(case 
		when last_check_status = 'OK' then 0
		when last_check_status = 'WARNING' then 1
		when last_check_status = 'CRITICAL' then 2
		else 3 end)
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_dim_check]
     WHERE [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
     AND check_enabled = 1

SELECT 
      [time] = snapshot_time --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,[SQL Memory] = [physical_memory_in_use_kb]*1.0/([physical_memory_in_use_kb]+[available_commit_limit_kb])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_process_memory]
  WHERE 1 = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
     AND snapshot_time >= dateadd(minute,-15,getutcdate())
  ---GROUP BY snapshot_time --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT 
      [time] = snapshot_time --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
      ,[Pending] = [runnable_tasks_count]+work_queue_count+pending_disk_io_count
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_schedulers]
  WHERE 1 = 1
  AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  AND [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
     AND snapshot_time >= dateadd(minute,-15,getutcdate())
  --GROUP BY snapshot_time --$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
ORDER BY
  time ASC

SELECT 
      [time] = snapshot_time --$__timeGroup(t.[snapshot_time], $aggregation)
      ,'CPU Usage %' = t.[cntr_value_calculated]
  FROM (SELECT 
	 snapshot_time
	,[cntr_value_calculated]=sum(pc.[cntr_value_calculated])
	FROM [dbo].[sqlwatch_logger_perf_os_performance_counters] pc
		inner join [dbo].[sqlwatch_meta_performance_counter] mpc
			on pc.sql_instance = mpc.sql_instance
			and pc.performance_counter_id = mpc.performance_counter_id  
	WHERE $__timeFilter(pc.snapshot_time)
	AND mpc.counter_name IN ('CPU usage %')
	AND pc.instance_name NOT IN ('internal')
	AND pc.[sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
	   AND snapshot_time >= dateadd(minute,-15,getutcdate())
	GROUP BY snapshot_time) t
 -- GROUP BY snapshot_time --$__timeGroup(t.[snapshot_time], $aggregation)
ORDER BY
  time ASC

options.content: The table shows average values over time, giving you a quick view of which server is taking up the most, or the least CPU, memory etc. You can set the time range in the time picker and use table header to sort and filter.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT --repository_dashboard_table
	   'Batch Requests/sec' = avg(case when counter_name = 'Batch Requests/sec' then [cntr_value_calculated] else null end)
	  ,'Readahead pages/sec' = avg(case when counter_name = 'Readahead pages/sec' then [cntr_value_calculated] else null end)
	  ,'Transactions/sec' = max(case when counter_name = 'Transactions/sec' then [cntr_value_calculated] else null end)
	  ,'Processes blocked' = avg(case when counter_name = 'Processes blocked' then [cntr_value_calculated] else null end)
	  ,'User Connections' = avg(case when counter_name = 'User Connections' then [cntr_value_calculated] else null end)
	  ,'Logins/sec' = avg(case when counter_name = 'Logins/sec' then cntr_value_calculated else null end)
	  ,pc.sql_instance
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_performance_counters] pc
  WHERE [aggregation_interval_minutes] = 1
   AND $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
   AND counter_name IN ('Batch Requests/sec','Readahead pages/sec','Transactions/sec','Processes blocked','CPU usage %','User Connections','Logins/sec')
   GROUP BY pc.sql_instance

select t.sql_instance, 'Wait Time' = avg([Wait Time])
from (SELECT 
	   d.sql_instance, d.snapshot_time
      ,'Wait Time' = sum(wait_time_ms_delta / [delta_seconds]) 
      --,'Waiting Tasks' = convert(bigint,sum(waiting_tasks_count_delta / [delta_seconds]) / 1000) --this is similar to waiting tasks in SSMS
  FROM [dbo].[sqlwatch_logger_perf_os_wait_stats] d
  WHERE  $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  GROUP BY d.sql_instance, d.snapshot_time) t
  GROUP BY t.sql_instance

SELECT 
      sql_instance
      ,[Bytes Transferred] = AVG([bytes_written_per_second]+[bytes_read_per_second])
      ,[Latency] = MAX([io_latency_read]+[io_latency_write])
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_file_stats]
  WHERE $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  GROUP BY sql_instance

SELECT [time] = h.snapshot_time
      , [Long Processes] = count(distinct session_id)
      , h.sql_instance
  FROM [dbo].[sqlwatch_logger_snapshot_header] h --this is so we always get row to show the tile, even if there are no rows in the data view. otherwise the tile will not be shown
  left join [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_xes_long_queries] l
    on h.sql_instance = l.sql_instance
    and h.snapshot_time = l.snapshot_time
    and h.snapshot_type_id = l.snapshot_type_id
  WHERE h.snapshot_time >= dateadd(minute,-15,getutcdate())
   AND $__timeFilter(h.snapshot_time)
  group by h.snapshot_time, h.sql_instance
ORDER BY
  time desc

SELECT top 1 [time]=$__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation) 
,[SQL Instance]=count(h.sql_instance)
  FROM dbo.sqlwatch_logger_snapshot_header h
  where snapshot_type_id = 1
    AND h.[sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
   AND $__timeFilter(h.snapshot_time)
  group by $__timeGroup([snapshot_time], $aggregation)

SELECT [time] = getdate(),
 [Checks] = max(case 
		when last_check_status = 'OK' then 0
		when last_check_status = 'WARNING' then 1
		when last_check_status = 'CRITICAL' then 2
		else 3 end)
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_dim_check]
     WHERE [sql_instance] IN ($sql_instance)
     AND check_enabled = 1

SELECT 
       sql_instance
      ,[SQL Memory] = AVG([physical_memory_in_use_kb]*1.0/([physical_memory_in_use_kb]+[available_commit_limit_kb]))
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_process_memory]
  WHERE $__timeFilter(snapshot_time)
  GROUP BY sql_instance

SELECT t.sql_instance, [Pending] = avg([Pending])
from (SELECT 
      os.sql_instance , os.snapshot_time
      ,[Pending] = MAX([runnable_tasks_count]+work_queue_count+pending_disk_io_count)
  FROM [dbo].[vw_sqlwatch_report_fact_perf_os_schedulers] os
  WHERE $__timeFilter(os.snapshot_time)
   GROUP BY os.sql_instance, os.snapshot_time
) t
GROUP BY t.sql_instance

SELECT t.sql_instance
      ,'CPU Usage %' = avg(t.[cntr_value_calculated])
  FROM (SELECT 
	 snapshot_time, pc.sql_instance
	,[cntr_value_calculated]=sum(pc.[cntr_value_calculated])
	FROM [dbo].[sqlwatch_logger_perf_os_performance_counters] pc
		inner join [dbo].[sqlwatch_meta_performance_counter] mpc
			on pc.sql_instance = mpc.sql_instance
			and pc.performance_counter_id = mpc.performance_counter_id  
	WHERE $__timeFilter(pc.snapshot_time)
	AND mpc.counter_name IN ('CPU usage %')
	AND pc.instance_name NOT IN ('internal')
	GROUP BY snapshot_time, pc.sql_instance) t
  GROUP BY t.sql_instance
